intro: Cyperus rotundus f. inconspicuus, commonly known as the slender sedges, is a variant of the common flatsedge. It is a perennial herb characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. This plant typically grows in wet or moist soils, often found in marshy areas or along waterways. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous root system and a compact, upright growth habit. The subspecies is distinguished by its reduced floral structures compared to the typical form.
